column4: is anyone in the mood to help me setting up my laptop as internet gateway (internet sharing)
i just installed 12.04 and now all my settings for internet sharing from my previous install is lost... I would really appreciate some help restoring my gateway
anyone?
do you remember (or have a copy of) how you set it up last time?
I am afraid not... if I did I believe that I would be able to solve it on my own...
loop-: what do you need the library for?
loop-: sorry, he left and auto-complete changed :(

Ok, perhaps I should get to the point what I need trouble shooting for: I have set my wlan connection as "Shared with other computers", but when I connect the eth2 where the client is, I loose internet access
the eth2 is connected to a router on its wan port
please describe your routing (ex: client computer wan => ubuntu wan -> ubuntu lan => router lan -> router wan => internet)
*the internet* -> router -> this computer wlan2 -> this computer eth2 -> router
so you are connnecting 2 routers together?
using your ubuntu box?
I am trying to extend the wifi another building, but the signal is weak from the first router
so behind the second router is where I plan to connect the clients in this building
http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Repeater_Bridge may work, but I don't think you'll get wifi off the third router
But the annoying thing is that it worked just fine before
and I haven
you would either need 1) a router with dual antenas, which are not that expensive 2) a third router to plug into the second 3) just use wired clients on the second router
and I havent changed anything in the router
do you need wirelss at the secondary location?
not crucial, but since I did have it before I kind of got used to it
